c74object.name: orchidea.solution.totext
c74object.digest: Import orchidea solution into a text object
c74object.description: Receives the output of orchidea.solve and fills a given text object with the global connection or with a specific orchidea solution, in textual form.

inlet.description: The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.
Second inlet receives the number of the segment whose solutions are to be imported. If the number 0 (as a single integer) is received instead, the global connection is imported (default).

outlet.description: The outlet should be connected to a text object (it will output the proper read message in order to fill it).

objarg.name: segmentnumber
objarg.description: The argument sets the the number of the segment whose solutions are to be imported. If the number 0 (as a single integer) is received instead, the global connection is imported (default).

method.name: int
method.description: An integer in the right inlet sets the segment for which the solutions should be imported (0 = global connection, default).

method.name: list
method.description: Left inlet should be connected to the leftmost output of a orchidea.solve object, that will send the need information about all the solutions (prefix, number of segments and number of solutions for each segment). When such list is received, the solutions for the desired segment (see int message) is imported into the text object connected to the object's outlet.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (list)
entry.description: Solution information. The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (int)
entry.description: Segment number. Second inlet receives the number of the segment whose solutions are to be imported. If the number 0 (as a single integer) is received instead, the global connection is imported (default).

entry.name: Outlet 1 (bang)
entry.description: Messages for text object. The outlet should be connected to a text object (it will output the proper read message in order to fill it).
